form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE Immigration and Naturalization Service, 9-132-St.Paul-C 9-19-47

full_text: Form 9-132-St.Paul-0 9-19-47 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE Immigration and Naturalization Service 1014 New Post Office Building Saint Paul 1, Minnesota July 8, 1949 File No. 0900/33210 Maling Liu 630 Lincoln N. E. Minneapolis 13, Minn. Dear Sir The records of this Service show that the time for which you were admitted to the United States temporarily as a non-quota student will expire August 7. 1949 If you intend to continue your studies beyond that period, the enclosed application for extension of stay (Form I-535) duplicate, should be completed in every detail, after which you should bring it personally to Room 1014, New Post Office Building, St. Paul, Minnesota, any week day except Saturday or a holiday between 8: a.m. and 3:30 p.m. You should also bring the record of admission which you received at the time of entry (Form I-94), and passport or other travel document valid at least sixty days beyond the date to which you seek an extension. If you have completed your studies or expect to do so before the period of your present stay expires and you plan to leave the United States, it is requested that this letter be delivered to an officer of the Immigration and Naturalization Service at the port of departure. Very truly yours, Irvin F. Shrode Officer in Charge By: D. Perfetto Assistant Officer in Charge P. S. If you intend to apply for a further extension of time, youshould submit either a letter from the University of Minnesota showing that you are registered there for the present summer session, or that you will be accepted there for fall registration. RMG/RFS out 8.7-49
